medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain focusing in the right lower quadrant (RLQ) after 24 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began approximately 24 hours prior to admission, starting as a band across the upper and lower abdomen and progressing to focus in the RLQ. The intensity of the pain worsened throughout the night, with some alleviation noted after a bowel movement at 3am. The patient also experienced dizziness, nausea without vomiting, and cold sweats.
medical_history.past_medical_history: CAD with stents, Hyperlipidemia, Atrial fibrillation on Xarelto.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from myocarditis, mother died from liver cancer (did not drink alcohol), paternal grandfather died of myocardial infarction. No siblings. Three children all healthy.
